H0.text: Seismic waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

H1.text: Deep waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

H2.text: Volcanic waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

H3.text: Particle waves are the energy waves that radiate out from the center of an earthquake.

A4.text: It can result from an earthquake (or generally, a quake), volcanic eruption, magma movement, a large landslide and a large man-made explosion that produces low-frequency acoustic energy.

A5.text: Every earthquake produces different types of seismic waves, which travel through rock with different velocities.

A6.text: S waves and later arriving surface waves do most of the damage compared to P waves.
